About Me

Hi, there! My name's Brian, and I'm currently a sophomore at The University of Texas at Dallas exploring Software Engineering and Entrepreneurship.

Steve Jobs once said, "The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle." I fully resonate with this quote. People often ask me how I manage to survive my rigorous schedule of classes, research, internships, and organizations. My answer is always the same: because I genuinely love what I do, and I intend to keep it that way.

Currently, I'm running an artificial intelligence nonprofit and a virtual reality software venture. During my spare time, I enjoy playing piano, self-studying, and watching horror movies.

My Skills

Where do they come from?

My latest coursework involves Java, Assembly, probability, and statistics. Outside of classes, I dabble in HTML to maintain four websites, and am currently learning C# for virtual reality development in Unity.

My experiences in management come from co-founding and running two student organizations, a nonprofit, and a startup in college. I believe that my leadership has built a robust foundation for future entrepreneurial endeavors.
